Kirsten Gillibrand focused her attention on two issues-cybersecurity and the hoarding of rare earth elements( REEs)- where she feels the Chinese are behaving inappropriately. Cybersecurity and REEs greatly affect both the national and economic security of the United States, and I continue to be concerned about China's policies regarding these two strategic interests, she wrote in her letter. Kirsten Gillibrand 's letter comes on the heels of a formal complaint by Senator Charles Ellis Schumer who has been a strong voice against the Chinese for much of the past decade. I have been protecting antiquities all my life. I felt if the Cairo museum is robbed, Egypt will never be able to get up again.
